headline: The Air Force Asked L3Harris: Can You Build Us a Fighter Plane for Less Than $50 Million?
summary: If I ask which American defense companies build fighter planes, what names come first to mind?  Lockheed Martin (NYSE: LMT), I'll bet, maker of the F-16 Falcon, the F-22 Raptor, and the F-35 Lightning II. Boeing (NYSE: BA), too, probably, with its F-15 Strike Eagles and F/A-18 Hornets.  You almost certainly do not think of L3Harris (NYSE: LHX), which is best known for producing radios, sensors, and (since acquiring Aerojet Rocketdyne) rocket engines.
